Description: Liquid biopsy and next-generation sequencing (NGS) have essential roles in cancer research. In our presentation, scientific experts will introduce new liquid biopsy workflows and describe the identification of neoantigens from various cancer types. Session 1: Preanalytical workflows for cell-free DNA (cfDNA) are well established for plasma but are lacking for urine samples. This session will walk you through urine cfDNA workflows, focusing on sample stabilization. Session 2: Neoantigen-based immunotherapy as a vaccine strategy can potentially provide personalized cancer treatment. This session will present the identification and validation of immunogenic neoantigens from RNA fusions across cancer types using NGS technology.
Location: Spotlight Theater D - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
